> There is no other knob or indication available to robot if the handle has completed one full rotation. If there is a small patch on one spot, then visually it can detect one full rotation.

It's true that visual feedback is a bit more difficult without markers, but there are 2 types of physical feedback when the valve is completely open:

1. The wheel reaches the end stop and can't be turned anymore
1. The door is unlocked and can be pushed
content.html:
There is no other knob or indication available to robot if the handle has completed one full rotation. If there is a small patch on one spot, then visually it can detect one full rotation.

It's true that visual feedback is a bit more difficult without markers, but there are 2 types of physical feedback when the valve is completely open:

  1. The wheel reaches the end stop and can't be turned anymore
  2. The door is unlocked and can be pushed
